remarks: This lemma is used to prove the existence of a function p as in Lemma 1 of [BrosowskiDeutsh] p. 90: p is in the subalgebra, such that 0 <= p <= 1, p_(t_0) = 0, and p > 0 on T - U. Z is used for t_0, P is used for p, ` ( G `` i ) ` is used for p_(t_i).  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:
stoweidlem37.1 $e |- Q = { h e. A | ( ( h ` Z ) = 0 /\ A. t e. T ( 0 <_ ( h ` t ) /\ ( h ` t ) <_ 1 ) ) } $.
stoweidlem37.2 $e |- P = ( t e. T |-> ( ( 1 / M ) x. sum_ i e. ( 1 ... M ) ( ( G ` i ) ` t ) ) ) $.
stoweidlem37.3 $e |- ( ph -> M e. NN ) $.
stoweidlem37.4 $e |- ( ph -> G : ( 1 ... M ) --> Q ) $.
stoweidlem37.5 $e |- ( ( ph /\ f e. A ) -> f : T --> RR ) $.
stoweidlem37.6 $e |- ( ph -> Z e. T ) $.
stoweidlem37 $p |- ( ph -> ( P ` Z ) = 0 ) $.
